title: PBS.Frontline.2015.My.Brothers.Bomber.1of3.720p.HDTV.x264.AAC
description:
My Brother's Bomber

Sociopolitical Documentary hosted by Ken Dornstein, published by PBS broadcasted as part of PBS Frontline series in 2015 - English narration
 
http://docuwiki.net/images/6/66/My-Brother-s-Bomber-Cover.jpg

Information
------------------------------

For some 25 years, filmmaker Ken Dornstein (A Death in Tehran) has been haunted by the bombing of Pan Am Flight 103 over Lockerbie, Scotland--a terrorist act that killed 270 people, including his older brother David.
Now, in this emotional and suspenseful three-part serial, Dornstein sets out to find the men responsible for one of the worst attacks on Americans before 9/11. From the ruins and chaos of post-Qaddafi Libya, Dornstein hunts for clues to the identities and whereabouts of the suspects, who he tracks for almost five years across the Middle East and Europe. With each episode, Dornstein encounters new witnesses and unearths fresh evidence that brings him closer to the truth about what really happened.
My Brother's Bomber is a rare, real-life spy thriller, but also a timely reflection on the legacy of America's long war on terror and a lyrical meditation on loss, love, revenge, and the nature of obsession.

Technical Specs
------------------------------


 * Video Codec: x264 CABAC   
 * Video Bitrate: ~1800 Kbps (CRF 21)
 * Video Resolution: 1280x720
 * Video Aspect Ratio: 16:9
 * Framerate: 29.970 fps
 * Audio Codec: AAC-LC (Nero)
 * Audio Quality: 0.48 48KHz (~132 Kbps)
 * Audio Channels: 2
 * Run-Time: ~56mn (each)
 * Number of Parts: 3
 * Part Size: ~780 MiB
 * Container: MP4
 * Released: 2015
 * Source: HDTV AVC 1080i
 * Encoder: KarMa
 * Subtitles: English - Merged in the MP4
